intro: Otostegia schennikovii, commonly known as the Schennikov's otostegia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
